revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Cisco |model=WAP371 |asin=B00L0LIM62;US; |fcc_date=05/23/2014 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=CyberTAN |type=access point |fcc_id=N89-WAP371 |ic_id=5005A-WAP371 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM53016A1 |cpu1_cspeed=1 GHz |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1_brand=SK Hynix |ram1_brand=SK Hynix |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM43460 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=none |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=1 |flags=RTC w/ battery backup |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_user=cisco |default_pass=cisco |oui=7C:69:F6 |oui_eth=7C:69:F6 }} {{TagLine|371 Series Wireless Access Point}} :{{ProductPage|https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/wireless/wap371-wireless-ac-n-dual-radio-access-point-single-point-setup/index.html}}
Default settings are per the FCC manual. :The used OUI (7C:69:F6) is per the FCC EUT's MAC label
Chip IDs are not legible in the FCC internal photos. Tom Carpenter's Blog (linked below) shows the 5 GHz radio but does not identify the CPU or the 2.4 GHz radio. Looking through other devices with the BCM43460 radio for clues, the BCM53016A1 CPU in the [[Linksys LAPAC1750PRO]] looks identical to the CPU in this device so we'll assume this uses the same CPU although it could be a different revision. The 2x2 2.4 GHz radio may be a BCM4352.
===Links=== * [http://www.tomcarpenter.net/2016/05/25/wireless-access-point-ap-internals-for-cisco-wap371/ ''WIRELESS ACCESS POINT (AP) INTERNALS FOR CISCO WAP371'' on '''Tom Carpenter's Blog'''] : "3763-50300103R" is silkscreened on the board
